message: Let's be fair, Bob. I propose a 60/40 split to start.
I think a 65/35 split is more fair, given the changing value of the money. Let's get this done!
That's a substantial decrease for me, Bob. Let's try to find a more balanced agreement.
I understand the time pressure, Bob, but your offer was too low. How about 57/43? It's a smaller gain for me compared to my initial offer, reflecting the inflation.
I'm sticking with my previous offer -  60/40 is a fair compromise considering the inflation. Let's agree to this and move on.
You're not acknowledging the changing value of the money, Bob. This offer is even worse than your first one! I need to see a more realistic proposal.
Bob, we're running out of time.  I'm coming down to 54/46. This acknowledges the inflation but is still fair. Let's close this deal.
Time is running out Alice. 60/40 is a fair deal for both of us, let's make this happen!
Bob, this is getting ridiculous. Your offer gets worse with every round, even though the money is worth less and less!  I need to see some movement from you or this is going nowhere.
Okay Bob, last chance. 52/48. Take it or leave it. We both lose if we don't agree now!
Alice, we're both losing money with each round. Let's compromise at 55/45. It's the best way for us to get something out of this.
Okay Bob, 55/45 it is. Let's end this before we both lose out completely.
